sub_topic: Determining the VSEPR geometry of a molecule
message_1: What is the VSEPR geometry of a CO2 molecule?
message_2: The VSEPR geometry of a CO2 (carbon dioxide) molecule is linear. In CO2, the central carbon atom is double-bonded to two oxygen atoms. There are no lone pairs on the central carbon atom, resulting in a linear molecular geometry with a bond angle of 180 degrees.
